page.title: 16History of Pickering 3
page.content: After the Bronze Age the Romans came in about 70A.D.giving a sharp impulse to farming.They bred their horses on the Wolds and the limestone hills became sites for their villas and farmsteads.Roman roads started to cross the region. In Saxon/Norman times,in the village itself there were twenty farmers owning six teams of plough oxen between them.King William's decision to build a royal Motte and Bailey Castle on the steep-sided site to the north of the village green ensured the continuance of Pickering and changed the shape of the town.The church is mentioned as existing from the time of Edward the Confessor. During the Middle Ages the area was used extensively as a hunting forest.
